detaileddescription.para: This protected Filter subclass implements a non-interpolating digital delay-line. A fixed maximum length of 4095 and a delay of zero is set using the default constructor. Alternatively, the delay and maximum length can be set during instantiation with an overloaded constructor.
A non-interpolating delay line is typically used in fixed delay-length applications, such as for reverberation.
by Perry R. Cook and Gary P. Scavone, 1995 - 2005.
